The protocol describes the\nStandard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the optimization of advanced tertiary treatment of water, based on a comprehensive quality and risk assessment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"qqbk","text":"The water production for AWARE main activities includes three stages – disinfection by ultraviolet C radiation (UVC), storage for - (according to water load and season) and ozonation. The water quality is monitored at these three stages, for the parameters indicated in Figure 1 below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":129,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":131,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ajpnc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffr36","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"afs9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":43200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":288.9454545454546,"id":466548,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"1-.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhvycd64x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhvwcd64x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhvxcd64x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhvvcd64x.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5e8tn","text":"Sampling, Processing, and Analyses ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hb8a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao0uh","text":"Water samples are collected (see Figure 2) and processed within a interval, before being shipped for the partner responsible for the analyses (Table 1). In case no processing is needed, samples are frozen and stored at within .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":218,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":225,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5o3ej","text":"\nFor each sampling event, the date, day of the week and hour; the temperature and rain. Sampling points, indicated in Figure 2 were designated from A to I:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jfnv","text":"- Influent of primary treatment (A) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75gjc","text":"- Influent of biological treatment (activated sludge) (B) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"279mg","text":"- Treated secondary effluent (C) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pgsr","text":"- Sand filter effluent (D) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd9vo","text":"- UVC effluent (E) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnb4b","text":"- Storage for reuse tank effluent (F) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8c9kn","text":"- Ozonation effluent (1 dose, e.g., O3) - MITO3X technology - (G) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d5sfr","text":"- Effluent of the vacuum UV oxidation (VUV) (H) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbn27","text":"- Effluent of reactive storage / Influent of the recirculation aquaculture system (RAS) (I) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"513pc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cseq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aq4vp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"4":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":319.5272727272727,"id":466552,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"2--.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhv4cd64x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhv2cd64x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhv3cd64x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhvzcd64x.webp","width":580}}}}

steps.section: Methods: The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
Methods: The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ec5nf","text":"Method: Virus capture by filtration with Rexeed dialysis units, concentration with aluminium chloride, nucleic acid extraction and detection by RT-qPCR.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Methods: The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6llfq","text":"Observations: Samples were filtered within after collection the filtering membranes were immediately frozen and stored at till shipping in dry ice to the respective partner who proceeded for DNA extraction.
